com.esri.mo2.ui.tb
Class MeasureGeocodeToolBar

                                |
                                +--com.esri.mo2.ui.tb.MeasureGeocodeToolBar
All Implemented Interfaces:
Accessible, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, SwingConstants
public class MeasureGeocodeToolBar
extends BaseToolBar

This toolbar provides several actions among others that are used for measurement and geocoding. The actions supported by this Toolbar include:

  • Measurement - provides a rubberband tool for measuring distances on screen
  • Geocoding - opens a dialog for selecting a location based on a street address
  • MapTips - opens a dialog for choosing map tips
You must call the setMap method before using any of these actions.

Here is some sample code to show you how to add this ToolBar to your application: 

       import com.esri.mo2.ui.bean.Map;
       import com.esri.mo2.ui.tb.MeasureGeocodeToolBar;
       import java.awt.BorderLayout;
       import javax.swing.JFrame;

       public class App extends JFrame {
           public App() {
               Map map = new Map();
               getContentPane().add(map, BorderLayout.CENTER);
               MeasureGeocodeToolBar tb = new MeasureGeocodeToolBar();
               tb.setMap(map);
               getContentPane().add(tb, BorderLayout.NORTH);
           }
       }

See Also:
Map, GeocodingUI, MapTipsUI, Serialized Form
